Period poverty is a pressing issue affecting millions of women and girls worldwide. From lack of access to menstrual products to limited education about menstrual health, the barriers are many. This issue crucially impacts women and girls across the Lehigh Valley as well. This month we at VHP, along with our partners at Lehigh Valley Health Network and ALLENTOWN HEALTH BUREAU are collecting and distributing sanitary napkins, hygiene, and feminine care products to those in need. In an article published by Lehigh Valley News, Dr. Ashwini Kamath Mulki of LVHN Family Medicine and Valley Health Partners Family Health Center said, "The groups are working on a Menstrual Equity map for the city (of Allentown). It will be a simple map for menstruators to locate free period products and for anyone in the community to donate sanitary products to support this cause." We encourage autonomy over your health and well-being. As a community we can give women and girls leverage by advocating to end period poverty. If you want to donate sanitary napkins, hygiene, and or feminine products call 610-437-7760 for more information or follow the link https://lnkd.in/eGHQC_KR.

11

Did you know this week is National Volunteer Week? Our latest blog post dives into the incredible impact of volunteering for families in need. In Maine, where 42% of households struggle to make ends meet, lending a hand can transform lives and communities. Here's how: - Addressing Immediate Needs: From warm winter clothing to household essentials, volunteers ensure families have what they need to thrive. -Fostering Empowerment and Dignity: By offering support with respect and compassion, volunteers empower individuals and honor their dignity. - Building Social Connections: Volunteering creates bonds within communities, fostering a sense of belonging for all involved. - Promoting Health and Well-Being: Access to basic items is crucial for overall well-being, and volunteers play a vital role in ensuring families have what they need to stay healthy. - Empowering Sustainable Change: By volunteering, we not only address immediate challenges but also work towards creating a more equitable society for all. Learn more about the impact of volunteering and how you can get involved with Maine Children's Home: https://lnkd.in/eJyc63bB #Volunteer #communitysupport #makeadifference #volunteerappreciationmonth #volunteerweek #thankyou

Check out these upcoming Parenting Workshops presented by CCE Suffolk County Community Education! These free educational programs will help you learn valuable information to promote and understand youth mental health. ‚Ä¢ Talking to Kids about Difficult Things Tuesday, August 6th | 10:00am - 11:00am When our kids come to us with questions about the challenging things happening in our world today, it‚Äôs not always easy to find the right words to say. Sometimes the struggle is knowing that many of these things are out of our control and defy explanation. Register here: https://conta.cc/4dma0wN ‚Ä¢ Caring for Yourself in Stressful Times Tuesday, August 13th | 12:00pm - 1:00pm Often, we forget about self-care as we become stressed or overwhelmed, just when we need it most. Caring for oneself allows parents to be more resilient and better manage stress, allowing them to better care for their children and protect their mental health. Register here: https://conta.cc/3SoaBG2 ‚Ä¢ Recognizing and Managing Anxiety in Youth Friday, August 16th | 10:00am - 11:00a Anxiety has been on the rise over the past decade. This workshop helps parents explore how to distinguish anxiety from normal worries. Parents will learn practical parenting tips to support their children and build emotional resilience. Register here: https://conta.cc/4cYUOpk ‚Ä¢ Teens and Screens Thursday, August 22nd | 10:00am - 11:00am The ever-increasing presence of technology in teens‚Äô lives presents new opportunities, as well as potential questions and risks. This workshop explores the latest research on the impact of screens and parenting strategies around how to best in this technology-infused world. Register here: https://conta.cc/3SoO5gq ‚Ä¢ Parent Support Group Special Workshop on School Avoidance - August 5 ‚Ä¢ 5:00pm Other dates: August 7 - 12:00pm August 12 - 12:00pm August 14 - 12:00pm Join: https://conta.cc/3L7wx40 Meeting ID: 871 0307 7952 Meeting Password: 822376 Please contact the CCE Suffolk office if you have any special needs.

If you could benefit from the support of experts in distribution, e-commerce, manufacturing, legal, payroll, or something else, let us know by filling out our intake form. We will follow up with more information. Please share this invitation with anyone who might benefit from such support. https://lnkd.in/eXaxHqp5 Branchfood is honored to partner with the Rhode Island Minority Business Accelerator, an initiative of the Rhode Island Commerce Corporation on this program, Foster Garvey PC, CIC (Cambridge Innovation Center), and ConnectPay Payroll Services. Pay equity is a key part of our advocacy as co-founders of the Level Up Greater Pittsburgh Gender Pay Equity Campaign. This #PrideMonth, we're looking further into pay disparities for LGBTQ+ individuals in America. According to a Human Rights Campaign Foundation analysis of nearly 7,000 full-time LGBTQ+ workers, this population earns roughly 90¬¢ to every dollar made by a typical worker (defined as the median wage for all workers in the U.S.). Black and Indigenous LGBTQ+ people earn even less than this average 90¬¢, making 80¬¢ and 70¬¢ on average, respectively. Trans men make an average of 70¬¢ to a typical worker‚Äôs dollar, and trans women make an average of 60¬¢. Our Level Up Campaign works to close the wage gap in Pittsburgh. Read more about it by visiting ywcapgh.org/pay-equity.

Skills for Rhode Island's Future is committed to supporting jobseekers from all walks of life in their search for meaningful employment. We do our best work when we partner with others, whether we collaborate with other community organizations or across teams within our own! Last Thursday, May 2nd, our Client Services, Talent Acquisition, Career Services, RI Small Business HUB, and workABILITY teams participated in a multi-employer Veteran's Job Fair at Community College of Rhode Island's Knight Campus in Warwick, hosted by The Providence VA VBA Regional Office, Veteran Readiness & Employment (VRE) Division, CCRI Student Veterans, and the Rhode Island Department of Labor & Training. The event connected veterans and others with career opportunities and resources, and our SkillsRI teams personally met with over 30 jobseekers and almost every employer in attendance! Events like these are essential for informing and supporting those who may have barriers to employment, like Rhode Island's veteran population, and you never know where or when any given team member may lend specialized support or connect for an opportunity for work outside of their typical purview. Bill Harold, Supported Employment Coordinator for workABILITY, spotted and caught up with DATTCO, INC, a transportation company that attended the event looking to recruit new hires. DATTCO recently partnered with and successfully hired a workABILITY candidate for a role as a School Bus Monitor/Aide, so Bill took the opportunity to explore ways to collaborate further by introducing DATTCO's hiring team to members of SkillsRI's Client Services team for additional sourcing and roles. #SkillsRI and #workABILITY thank all of our community partners, employer partners, and the sponsors of this event for their support in providing resources to the veteran community and so many others! It often takes only one person or one effort to make a difference in the lives of others, so together, we should expect the impact of our work will be far greater! If you're an employer seeking talent, contact the workABILITY team to join our mission of providing equal opportunities for all! Learn more about partnering with us at https://lnkd.in/dF4B_qp3. #VeteranSupport #VeteranEmployment #JobFair #EqualOpportunities #SkillsRI #workABILITY #risbHUB #CCRI #RIDLT #RIJobs #RhodeIslandJobs #RhodeIsland #SupportOurVeterans U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

On Wednesday, June 26 at 1:00 pm EDT, please join Right at Home of Central New Jersey for a webinar on Promoting Healthy Aging of Adults With Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities (IDD). Using a life-course model of aging well with intellectual and developmental disabilities, this webinar will focus on the needs and challenges of adults with IDD, the social-environmental context of their lives, and strategies to improve and promote healthy aging. The discussion will provide examples of family support, environmental and technological interventions, and a family-centered approach to future planning. Participants in this webinar will be able to: --Describe the challenges and opportunities for adults aging with IDD. --Identify major demographic trends affecting adults aging with IDD. --Explain age-related changes in health and social-environmental context for adults aging with IDD. --Describe environmental and technological interventions to support adults aging with IDD and their families. To learn more about this important topic, please click on the link below to register. Please call us at Right at Home of Central New Jersey at 732-967-0900 if you have any questions. https://lnkd.in/gqFMj_NP #rightathomeofcnj #rahcnj #IDD

The conversation begins tonight at Nafasi on Centre! Are you ready to be part of a meaningful series of conversations that reshape our understanding of Black life in Pittsburgh? This is your chance to engage deeply and contribute to a vital community dialogue. Join us in "The Community Living Room" where a series of conversations dedicated to the rigorous exchange of Black knowledge traditions and Black life in Pittsburgh will unfold. Our goal is to share and transform our collective thinking about our lived experiences, cultural practices, education and traditions through a freedom-centered format of conversation. We will embrace our roles as learners and teachers within our community with the goal of anchoring our progress within the embrace of community. Relational Responsibilities: In our interconnected community, we are committed to: Active Listening: Truly hear and understand each other. Honest Challenging: Engage with ideas critically and respectfully. Dedicated Learning: Foster a productive learning environment where ideas are rigorously examined without personal disparagement. Expectations: We will practice: Listening and Hearing Deep Studying and Meaningful Contribution Engaging Generously: Explore possibilities, seek connections, deepen understanding, and embrace complexity over mere critique. Framework for Shared Inquiry: Stretch: Push questions beyond immediate concerns to explore broader implications. Resonance: Foster non-hierarchical collective action through questions that elicit deep, attentive responses. Resilience: Ensure questions remain flexible and connected to their purpose, adapting to changing circumstances and new discoveries. This event requires registration and confirmation by way of a follow-up email. Space is limited. Register here or through the link in our bio today. https://ow.ly/sAUg50Sk0J3
